fields.summary: Rest docs for issue transition has a typo.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43840].
  {panel}

Scenario:

A public Jira is setup for joint venture purposes. The configured roles are 
Administrator (projadmins)
Internal (internal users)
External (external company users)

Using the comment security feature an external user can hide comments from other users within the issue/Jira in a project that belongs to internal users/projleads/projadmins.

The permission I suggest is missing is the "View all comments" which should be set to the Administrator/Internal role.

Or: It should be possible to limit the comment security feature to specific roles.
fields.summary: Missing permission in permission scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43839].
  {panel}

As a JIRA administrator I want to configure heap and/or CPU limits for users or threads so that user activity can't take down JIRA.

h3. Problem Definition

Users can either accidentally or intentionally generate a huge result as the result of a search and this can make JIRA unresponsive to the point of requiring a restart.  Enterprise instances are more vulnerable because they have so many more records and concurrent users.

h3. Suggested Solution

* An admin screen where per-user or per-thread limits on heap and CPU consumption can be defined.
* When these limits are reached the thread in question should be killed or throw an exception.
* As a fallback alternative, it would be useful to a view of which threads are consuming large amounts of heap/CPU and which username is associated with them.

h3. Workaround

None... instances of any size can be taken down by a Lucene query with a sufficiently large result set to chew up all the heap.
fields.summary: Ability to limit heap and CPU consumption to prevent performance crashes
Gadgets not respecting new URL from App Link after migration
Like Button on Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43834].
  {panel}

Hi,

while the image selection plugin is a very nice addition, I would argue that most of the uploaded project icons don't need significant cropping.

If you currently upload an icon, the selection helper is quite small somewhere in the image:

!Screen Shot 2015-06-15 at 13.25.07.png|thumbnail!

I think it would be better if the selection area would "fit" in the selection, but stretching to touch at least two borders (like the CSS property {{background-size: contain;}} works):

For portrait images (“select full width and center vertically”):
!portrait.png|thumbnail!

For landscape images (“select full height and center horizontally”):
!landscape.png|thumbnail!

For square images (“select all”):
!square.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Maximize selection area when uploading a project image

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43829].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
When multiple mail handlers point to the same Mail Server, there is a race condition causing the handlers to miss emails as shown at: [JRA-42044|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42044]

*Suggestion:*
Since the race condition was closed as "Won't Fix", please create a restriction from the UI to prevent the creation of Mail Handlers on Mail Servers that already have a Mail Handler configured to it.

*Scenario:*
Administrators sometimes configure different Mail Handlers to one Mail Server and using the Catch Email functionality they split incoming emails into multiple projects.
fields.summary: Restrict Incoming Mail Handlers association to used Mail Servers
Specify the permissions to edit Filter Share

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43824].
  {panel}

Every single time I make an administrative  change now I get a pop-up notification covering up options I want to click that tells me something I know and find very annoying to be reminded about EVERY SINGLE TIME I make an administrative change.

I click the X on the notification and it pops right back up again when the page refreshes. I go and do what it says (re-index) and the instant I modify anything else it's popping the fuck back up again coving up something I want to read or interact with on the form.

Is there some option somewhere that I can modify to turn this feature off? Or, failing that, Is there a module somewhere I can disable to removing these annoyance level 11 notification pummelling?

I'm just positive there's more issues like this and this one'll be closed as a duplicate shortly after I create it but I really wanted to bitch about it for a while and get some friends to vote as well.

In the attached screenshots notice how I'm editing a field configuration not being used by any project changing the config to 'show' the environment field.

Screenshot #4 shows the notification blob that now is covering up two very useful buttons on the form.

Thanks,
-wc

William Crighton

/edit/
to me the easiest would be to just provide another dark feature type option that just disabled the notifications all together. They do provide value, however, so another approach would be to have a 'server notifications' page, much like the audit page, and people could subscribe to it.
fields.summary: Administrative notices are incredibly annoying - please provide option to disable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43823].
  {panel}

h3. Summary


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Hide Resolution field
#* Access JIRA
#* Click on the cogwheel icon
#* Click on Issues
#* Click on Field Configurations
#* Click on Configure, next to the scheme your project is using
#* Search for Resolution field, click on Hide located next to it
# Add the gadget Issue Statistics to your dashboard
#* Open your dashboard
#* Click on Add Gadgets
#* Search for "Issue Statistics"
#* Click on Add gadget button next to Issue Statistics
#* On the gadget, select a filter of the project which the scheme was configure on the step one
#* Click on Save

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should list the issue types of returned by the filter, the number and percentage of issues under those issue types

h3. Actual Results
No Data Available


h3. Notes
-

h3.Workaround
# Click on the cogwheel icon
# Click on Issues
# Click on Field Configurations
# Click on Configure, next to the scheme your project is using
# Search for Resolution field, click on Show located next to it
fields.summary: Issue Statistics gadget returns "No Data Available" if the field Resolution is hidden
Versions field should be descending

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+ # navigate to JIRA Administration -> System -> General Configuration -> Edit Settings # add the following simple HTML code to Introduction textarea: {code}

Welcome to JIRA

{code} # click Update # click Edit Settings again h4. +Expected behavior+ The Introduction textarea is unchanged h4. +Actual behavior+ The Introduction textarea becomes: {code}

Welcome to JIRA

{code} {panel}(!) An {{}} closing tag is automatically inserted. In this case, there's no side effect. However, with a more complex HTML code, unexpected behavior might be observed. {panel} {panel}(i) JIRA should not attempt to add any code to the gadget. Whether or not the code is erroneous should be up to JIRA admins to manage. {panel}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA administrator I would like the ability to disable automatic scheme creation during project creation as it creates significant amounts of cleanup work when creating large numbers of projects as a part of my daily tasks.

h3. Suggested Solution
In JIRA Administration page , provide option for customer to choose whether automatically create scheme or not . If the customer want to create by themselves when project creates , then it should be a pop up screen when create a project , for customer to choose the screen scheme.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to disable automatic scheme creation on project creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43816].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When JIRA is integrated with HipChat, HipChat will automatically picks up JIRA's base URL to create the integration at HipChat. No flexibility to specify the JIRA URL on HipChat side. 

h3. Suggested Definition
Have the ability to edit JIRA URL at the integration page in HipChat for the respective JIRA that is integrated .
fields.summary: Ability to change the JIRA URL link in HipChat

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As per the resolution of JRA-18032, when using the JQL automatic completion feature, it should choose to use the cf[#####] form when multiple of the same name custom field exist. This is not happening if the current user only has access to see one of the fields, for example they only have access to projects for which one of the custom fields does not have context. This especially causes problems when the type of custom field is different, causing the JQL to fail if you try to for example use the "~" operator because one field is of type text, but the other field is of type "select list" which does not support the "~" operator.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create Project A
# Create Project B
# Create two custom fields with the same name
# Change one of the custom fields so that it only has context on project B
# Configure separate permissions schemes on Project A and B
# Create a user and change Project B's permissions scheme such that the new user does not have browse access
# While logged in as that user, try to type in JQL in the advanced search, with the custom field name used for both custom fields, notice that only one of the values shows up in the list, but it includes the cf\[#####\] form
# Hit enter to select the custom field from the list of one

h3. Expected Results

# The cf\[#####\] form should be used in the JQL query

h3. Actual Results

# The quoted name of the custom field is used in the JQL query, making that query ambiguous

h3.Workaround

# Manually type the cf\[#####\] form of the custom field
# Use different names for different custom fields
fields.summary: JQL auto-completion does not use custom field ID if two custom field IDs exist with the same name but the current user only can see one of them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43805].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when users are created using project import, their last login information is not imported in the new instance.
Steps to reproduce : 
* Use project import to import data from another instance.
* Notice that it adds new users that are not already present on the instance.
* However it does not include the last login information for the users. 
* The last login information is shown as "not recorded".

h3. Suggested Solution
We would be able to import the last login information from the source instance. If not, there should be an option to set it to the import date.
fields.summary: As an admin I would like JIRA to import the last login data from project import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43800].
  {panel}

At the moment, users with the *Manage Group Filter Subscriptions* global permission are able to select any groups to be recipients of a filter subscription (source:https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Receiving+Search+Results+via+Email). It would be better if we can manage which groups shows up in the list in the first place.

Use Case:
# The default *jira-users* group shows up in the list. Users might accidentally select this group which will "spam" *all* users with this filter subscription. Hiding this group will avoid such situation.
# There might be certain groups meant for particular things which will not require to receive filter subscriptions at all so we should be able to just hide it from showing up in the first place
fields.summary: Hide groups from Filter Subscription

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43793].
  {panel}

h3. The JIRA installation documentation has an empty heading for SSL command line instructions in versions 6.0 - 6.4.  This has been corrected for the [latest version of the document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-commandline]. 

h3. Environment
* [For JIRA 6.4.0| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS]
* [For JIRA 6.0.0| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA060/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the [webpage(s)| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS]
# Witness an empty section under the Command Line Installation heading
# (There is also a link to this broken section)

h3. Expected Results
The heading should have some content underneath as per the latest document, or should be deleted.
h3. Actual Results
There is no command line information.

h3.Workaround
Point the customer to the latest documentation.
fields.summary: SSL Command Line instructions are missing in JIRA 6.0-6.4 documentation
Shortcut keys editable on JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43790].
  {panel}

Many security-minded companies like to configure the default users in the "user" project role such that administrators are not members.

If these administrators create a project, they get redirected to the "browse project" page ... which they are not allowed to see :(

We should not send users to dead ends.
Perhaps we should detect this and redirect to project admin page?

Otherwise, have a different permission violation message for admins than normal users.
We don't need to pretend "it may have been deleted".
Admins can always admin the project (and even give themselves permissions to browse) so the page is simply annoying.
Perhaps something like "You do not have permission to browse this project. Click here to go to the administration page."
fields.summary: Post project create screen can send admin to a dead end

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43789].
  {panel}

Create Custom Field with the following contexts:
- project A and project B, any issue type
- project C, issue types T1, T2, T3, T4
- global context, issue type T0

Try to create issue for project C and issue type T0:
- The custom field is not displayed on the create screen.
- If you use "Where is my field", there appear three green check marks and the message "The '...' field should be present on the form you are viewing".

If you create an issue for project C with issue type T1 to T4, the custom field is displayed correctly.
fields.summary: Custom Field not displayed in case of complex contexts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43788].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

* Create a workflow called "Foo Workflow"
* Confirm that the workflow is inactive
* Create an issue type called "Stuff"
* Edit an existing active workflow scheme
Associate the Foo Workflow with the Stuff Issue type.
* Confirm that the workflow is now active
* Delete the Issue Type

Expected:
The Foo Workflow is inactive again

Actual:
The Foo Workflow is listed as active but associated with no schemes :(
fields.summary: Deleting an issue type does not make workflows become inactive
QuickCreateIssue.sessionComplete is triggered twice

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43786].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When deleting users, feature settings for the user is not deleted. 

This can be reproduced as follows:
# Create a user
# Set a dark feature setting for that user (e.g. com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation.Disabled, by disabling the new Project Navigation from the User Profile)
# Delete the user
# Run the following SQL against the database
{code}select * from feature where user_key=deletedusername{code}
You'll see that the setting remains.

Additionally, when a user is recreated, the settings are all automatically re-applied, which may not be desirable in some use-cases.

h3. Suggested Solution
Delete all settings associated with a user when the user is deleted, so that all users would be in a default state when created (or re-created) until they begin to change settings.
fields.summary: Feature settings for users are not removed when users are deleted

fields.description:

see attached PowerPoint for a more detailed description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43781].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
# JIRA is linked to Confluence using 2-Legged OAuth
# A JIRA issue is linked to a Confluence page
# A non-Confluence JIRA user (has a JIRA account but not a Confluence account) is not able to view the Confluence page title while viewing the JIRA issue
#* If User Impersonation is not used, the user will see:
!2_legged.png|thumbnail!
#* If User Impersonation is used, the user will see:
!impersonation.png|thumbnail!
(/) these are *expected*
# A JIRA user who is also a Confluence user but does not have the permission to view the Confluence page will see:
!500_error.png|thumbnail!
(!) this is not expected, as the user should also see that he doesn't have the permission to view that page, rather than the page can't be loaded, which is misleading
(i) similarly, the browser should return a 403 error instead of 500
+JIRA Log:+
{code}
2015-06-08 18:58:51,976 http-bio-2768-exec-8 ERROR andy 1138x3274x1 1t5y8q9 192.168.1.100,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/viewIssue/1/remoteIssueLink/render/10100 [viewissue.issuelink.rest.RemoteIssueLinkResource] Error occurred while generating final HTML for remote issue link: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Failed to load Confluence Page from remote server Caused by: java.io.IOException: Failed to load Confluence Page from remote server Caused by: com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Status Code: 200, Status Text: OK, Errors: {}, Error Messages: [java.lang.Exception: com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.RemoteException: You're not allowed to view that page, or it does not exist.]
{code}

h4. +Suggestion+
JIRA should be able to detect whether the Confluence page does not exist, or the user who is viewing the JIRA issue doesn't have the permission to view that Confluence page:
# if Confluence page does not exist (or JIRA can't connect to Confluence to determine that), it's fine to display "Failed to load" and throw 500 error
# if the user does not have the permission to view it, JIRA should display "You do not have permission to view this page" and throw 403 error
fields.summary: Improve Warning Messages when JIRA User is Not Allowed to view Confluence Page

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian,

our user has reported broke Date in the field "Resolved" in the Issue Navigator / List view.

On the screenshot, you can see columns "Resolved", "Created" and "Updated". If there is Date with format containing spaces, the columns "Created" and "Updated" have content nice on one line, but the column "Resolved" has content splitted on two (or more) lines. Date format without spaces is not split.

I have found that the Resolved, Created and Updated Dates are defined in HTML as TD with class  "resolutiondate", "created" and "updated". For "created" and "updated" classes there is CSS definition "#issuetable .created" and "#issuetable .updated" with "white-space: nowrap;" style.

But the style definition is missing for "resolutiondate". There is only CSS definition for class "resolution" for field "Resolution".

The style is loaded by Webbrowser from HTML page from file /s/5878a7ab84fb43402106c575658472fa-CDN/en_US44281c/6339/167/41/_/download/superbatch/css/batch.css, but I found the definition "#issuetable .created" in the file atlassian-jira/ui/aui-layout/issue-table.less.css and there is probably missing the definition for class "resolutiondate".

Could you please fix this CSS?

Thank you.

Regards,

Robert Wolf.
fields.summary: Missing CSS class "resolveddate" definition for "Resolved" Time in Issue Navigator / List view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43779].
  {panel}

h1.Missing native packages for atlassian products.
    * We see that jira, stash, bamboo, confluence, crowd are upgraded very frequently.
        ** This is good in many ways.
        ** When there is no real unattended upgrade, it leads to a lots of cost.
    * The cost of upgrading the atlassian-stack, is roughly the same as we pay in licenses. We start to wonder if the atlassian stack was a mistake because of the extra hidden cost of the product.
    * For Atlassian it should be a one or two engineers to fix this problem for all the customers.
    * Similarly for each of your customers, it is 10% of one engineer pr company.
    * Given that you probably have approx 40,000 customers, this means that instead of spending 2 engineers (one for RHEL/CentOS/Fedora?) and one for Ubuntu/Debian, we - your customers spend 10% * 40,000 ≃ 4,000 engineers on updating the atlassian stack.

Please include yum-repos for your products!
fields.summary: Lack of update repository leads to double cost of the atlassian products.
Allow XML backup to be Automatically Restored

fields.description:
Global actions were re-introduced into JIRA in the JIRA 6.4 release. See JRA-36498

When you attempt to import this workflow into any JIRA before this, you receive the following errors:
!screenshot-1.png!
{noformat}/rest/workflowDesigner/latest/workflows [plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.WorkflowLayoutsImpl] Error serializing workflow layout for workflow EXS Default Workflow, draft = false
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.LayoutSerializationException: org.codehaus.jackson.map.exc.UnrecognizedPropertyException: Unrecognized field "loopedTransitionContainer" (Class com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.Layout), not marked as ignorable
 at [Source: java.io.StringReader@525d0cab; line: 1, column: 2363] (through reference chain: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.Layout["loopedTransitionContainer"])
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.utilities.JsonSerializer.deserialize(JsonSerializer.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.LayoutSerializerImpl.deserializeFromJson(LayoutSerializerImpl.java:30)
	at com.sysbliss.jira.plugins.workflow.manager.WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.getLayout(WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.java:108)
	at com.sysbliss.jira.plugins.workflow.manager.WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.getExistingLayoutOrCreate(WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.java:72)
{noformat}
So on and so forth.

Workaround:
# Download a copy of the workflow-designer for 6.4.0 [^workflow-designer-plugin-6.4-D20150109T010200.jar]
# Stop your currently running JIRA.
# Replace the workflow-designer plugin in {{$JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/}} (It will be named workflow-designer-plugin-6.3.xx.jar where xx is the version number) with the copy you downloaded in step 1.
# Restart JIRA. 
(!) This has only been tested for JIRA 6.3.x (!)
fields.summary: New Global Actions cause errors in Workflow designer when imported into older JIRA versions
Update the JIRA Requirements Document
Application Documentation Error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cloud backups from version 6.5-OD-05-041 will fail when restored to JIRA 6.4.6 with the following error.

{noformat}
2015-06-09 16:07:16,725 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR sysadmin 967x379x1 bp1lvx 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [jira.bc.dataimport.DowngradeUtil] Downgrade cannot proceed: Cannot downgrade data - missing downgrade task 65001
{noformat}

h3. Environment
This issue is experienced with JIRA 6.4.6 on any Supported Operating System.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a JIRA 6.4.6 instance
# Attempt to restore a backup generated from a cloud instance running version 6.5-OD-05-041

h3. Expected Results
The Cloud Import should succeed as the installer reports compatibility with the following strange warning when trying to import: 
{noformat}
The file you are trying to import is from JIRA 6.5-OD-05-041, which is newer than your current version of JIRA and will not work. The import file claims it can be successfully imported into JIRA 6.3.12 or later.
{noformat}


h3. Actual Results
The Import fails with an error which can be observed in the {{atlassian-jira.log}}:

{noformat}
2015-06-09 16:07:16,725 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR sysadmin 967x379x1 bp1lvx 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [jira.bc.dataimport.DowngradeUtil] Downgrade cannot proceed: Cannot downgrade data - missing downgrade task 65001
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Using an older version of JIRA, such as [JIRA 6.4.5 |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+6.4.5+Release+Notes] which can be downloaded from the [JIRA Downloads Archive|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-archives] will enable to you to workaround the issue.
fields.summary: XML Restores from Cloud version 6.5-OD-05-041 to JIRA 6.4.6 Fails
Better log information when testing the LDAP connection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43770].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
When using the Linux installer for JIRA, the bundled [JIRA Configuration Tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool] does not start, unless you have a local Java installation properly configured on your system. This is problematic, as the Linux installer does bundle Java, but {{config.sh}} never picks up those variables.

h4. Symptoms
You will notice the following error on the console:
{noformat}
No JRE_HOME or JAVA_HOME environment variable is set - attempting to just run java command{noformat}

In addition, the configuration tool is not launched.

(i) *Note:* If you have a working {{java}} command, the tool may still launch while seeing the above warning.

h4. Workaround
h5. Install Java
The best solution is to [install Java for JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+Java], preferably the latest from the [supported platforms page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] of your JIRA version.

This is recommended anyways, as generally new Java versions bring security and performance improvements.

h5. Use the bundled Java
You can invoke {{setenv.sh}} from the same {{bin}} directory where {{config.sh}} can be found. This should set the bundled Java's environment variables. Best is to invoke {{setenv.sh}} in {{config.sh}}.
fields.summary: No JRE_HOME or JAVA_HOME in linux server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43767].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Take the latest JIRA Cloud backup.
# Install JIRA 6.4.6.
# Put the Cloud backup on the _JIRA Home > import_
# Run the Setup Wizard.
# Choose Import Data
# Put the Backup name on the File Name

*Expected Result*:
* There will be a warning, but there is an option that able to be clicked to proceed the restore.

*Actual Result:*
* The warning below appears:
!646cloudrestore.PNG|thumbnail!

*Workaround* 
Try restoring to a slightly older JIRA server version e.g. 6.4.5 if possible.

*NOTES:*
- JIRA 6.4 also have the same problem.
fields.summary: Unable to Restore Backup from Cloud 6.5-OD-05-041 to JIRA Server
Ability to search issues where Reporter is the same user who transition the issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The collation check introduced by JRA-39970 is checking the wrong attribute for Oracle. It's looking at NLS_CHARACTERSET, which defines the character set, and not the NLS_SORT which defines the collation.

h3. Environment

Verified on:

* Oracle 12c
* JIRA 6.4.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Ensure your Oracle database uses BINARY for NLS_SORT
# Install JIRA to connect to Oracle as per the directions [Connecting JIRA to Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+Oracle]
# Start JIRA
# Look at the log file

h3. Expected Results

No warnings regarding collation are logged, as the correct collation is in use.

h3. Actual Results

The warning is logged in the atlassian-jira.log file:

{noformat}
2015-06-09 08:01:04,432 http-bio-8080-exec-15 WARN anonymous 480x10x1 1llnki2 172.17.42.1 /secure/SetupDatabase.jspa [jira.appconsistency.db.CollationCheck] 

****************************************************************************************************
You are using an unsupported oracle10g collation: AL32UTF8. This may cause some functionality to not work.
Please use BINARY as the collation instead.
****************************************************************************************************
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround

Ignore the warning, since it's not actually valid in this case.
fields.summary: Collation check for Oracle is looking incorrectly at NLS_CHARACTERSET instead of NLS_SORT

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43760].
  {panel}

At the moment, JIRA has 4 ways to handle Bulk emails
* Ignore the email and do nothing
* Forward the email to a specific account
* Delete the email
* Accept the email for processing

It would be great if we have the option to "reply" to these emails as well. It will work the same way as *Forward the email to a specific account* except that instead of forwarding to a specific account, it will forward it back to the sender, thus acting like a "reply"
fields.summary: Allow mail handler to "reply" bulk email received
Verify JIRA support for Oracle TDE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43753].
  {panel}

until today it always worked. I did on my local computer:
_git commit -m "PRJ-XXX #done something to say"_

and then _git push_ and then the commit would be pushed to bitbucket and then with the hook installed it's moved to Jira and sets the issue status to done.

Today this failed. The commit can be viewed from the Jira view of the issue (there's a link to the commit in bitbucket) but the issue stays unresolved
fields.summary: Jira doesn't resolve issue after bitbucket commit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43752].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Using [JIRA for Assets Management|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2015/03/free-ebook-jira-service-desks-guide-asset-management/] requires users to enter several issues at once. 

Albeit JIRA allows users to use the "create another" feature to log issues one after another, that is tiresome when entering many issues, specially as you have to wait for the form to be submitted to fill another issue.

And creating CSV files requires you to create a separate file, which becomes more and more complicate, and requires users to manage things in excel and then export to CSV and import into JIRA, which duplicates the information the user needs to store (once in Excel and then in JIRA).

\\

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if JIRA provided a "Bulk Create" feature, which would allow the user to select the project / issue type in which the issue would be created.

Then, select what fields would be available to enter (similarly to how the Create Issue screen works with the *Configure Fields*). 

The user could then simply use tab to go through all fields of the issue. Once it hits the end of the row, it would add a new line with empty fields for a new issue - similarly to how adding rows to a Confluence Table works. After filing the "rows" of the "table", the user can just submit the form once, which would create all needed issues.
fields.summary: As a JIRA User, I'd like to create multiple issues at once
Limit @ mention list to authorized users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43749].
  {panel}

It would be nice if JIRA supported ldap direct bind to avoid needing to define a single user for the ldap connection. Here's some additional information on this connection method. 

https://pythonhosted.org/django-auth-ldap/authentication.html#direct-bind

A member of the community has written a seraph authentication plug-in as an example. 

https://bitbucket.org/akutz/ldap-directbind
fields.summary: Add Support for LDAP Direct Binding
Restrict Comment Visibility

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When browsing through JIRA issue navigator, once you click to a linked issue through original issue, clicking back from the browser button, does not bring back user to the previous page, instead, its stuck at the linked issue. ( URL is having the previous page URL) 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Can be tested on official https://jira.atlassian.com
1. goto search for issues
2. advanced search
{code}
project = JRA AND key = JRA-43737
{code}
3. *Change to list view*, scroll down to JRA-43737
4. click on JRA-43737 The 'guide' link does not work.
5. scroll down to Issue links and click on CONF-37787 Link not working
6. now click the "back" button of the browser
7. browser goes to "Issue links" of CONF-37787 instead of back to JRA-43737
8. now press F5 and browser goes back to JRA-43737

h3. Expected Results
* When clicking back, the previous page should loads

h3. Actual Results
* No changes, instead stays on the linked issue's page

h3.Workaround
* Force page to refresh by using F5 key
fields.summary: Not able to navigate to original issue through linked issue
Make In Group search under User Management not case sensitive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43736].
  {panel}

It seems like the green "issue created" notification flag notifies you now if you have created a new component. This is great, a neat feature. However, if you cancel or close that Component before submitting the issue via the Create transition, the Component does not created. This is expected.

The bug is that the success "issue created" notification flag still notifies you as if you created a Component.

(!) You must be project admin to add components 
# Open the Create Issue dialog
# Fill in the Summary and add a Component that doesn't exist \\ !screenshot-1.png!
# Close the new Component \\ !screenshot-2.png!
# Create the Issue
# Look at the notification \\ !screenshot-3.png!
# Notice that the component hasn't actually be created \\ !screenshot-4.png!
fields.summary: As an Project Administrator, if I type a new Component but remove it, JIRA still notifies me as I if created a component

fields.description:
I've got a big problem with JIRA working togehter with Stash on the server.

*Database*: MySQL
*System*: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS 64-Bit with Apache
*JIRA path*: /opt/jira
*JIRA home path*: /var/jira-home
*Stash path*: /opt/stash
*Stash home path*: /var/stash-home

I installed the standalone version from JIRA on the server with this manual: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Installing+JIRA+Standalone+on+Unix+or+Linux] I installed Stash on the same way. It seems that JIRA and Stash uses each his own Tomcat.

JIRA is working correct, as long as Stash is not running. If I start Stash with the startup.sh (or start-stash.sh) Stash is working, but the Tomcat of JIRA crashes without an error message. The catalina.out has no information about the crash. If I stop the tomcat of Stash and start JIRA again, JIRA is working correctly. 

So it's only possible to use one of them. I hope anyone can help with this problem.
fields.summary: JIRA is crashing together with Stash

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Pie+Chart+Gadget
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Adding+the+Pie+Chart+Gadget

A related page in the AOD space has been changed already. See https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Adding+the+Pie+Chart+Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43733].
  {panel}

Create 2 filters. Have one find 1 set of tickets and have the second find another set of tickets. 

Now one after the other, load them in separate tabs. To make it really obvious, open the first, wait until it fully loads, then open the second.

Now, start a bulk change on the first one that loaded. You will see that filter 1 is actually displaying! This can be really confusing if you haven't already experienced it! It defies sense.

I didn't dare see on my local machine which set ends up being used for the bulk operation...but I wouldn't be surprised if the wrong set gets used...it might explain why bulk operations in the past for me went awry.
fields.summary: Bulk change on filters step on each other

fields.description:

h3. Problem Definition
Ability to configure jira default with  international number format for the , that means that a number like 100000 should be displayed as
100.000 instead of 100,000 

h3. Workaround 
The only workaround available is to remove any format to show 100000 instead of 100,000
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Remove+Commas+for+Values+held+in+Number+Field+Custom+Field+Type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43727].
  {panel}

Add in permission to allow disabling clone issue per project.

Currently what is available is available by disabling the View Issue Ops Bar Clone Link in Manage Add-ons using the steps below:

# You must be a JIRA Administrator with access to add-ons
# Go to {{Add-ons > Manage add-ons}}
#  Select to see System add-ons by changing from *User Installed* to *All* Add-ons
#  Find *Issue Operations Plugin*
#  Expand modules
#  Find *View Issue Ops Bar Clone Link* and disable it! 

Can a permission to clone issues be added in which would allow users to:
# Specify who can clone issues
# Specify which projects would allows users to clone issues in.
fields.summary: Allow disabling of Clone issue per project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43726].
  {panel}

In addition I already found this issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-20505 but this was only for JIRA and the regarding footer. 

*Background*
In general the full stack of Atlassian products is providing many meta information to anonymous users. That does not only affects the footer which can be adjusted manually for each product (See end-user-agreement, 6.4 Attribution) but also the information within html headers.

Providing those information even to anonymous users on any login mask could be abused to identify security flaw. So if we just remove the version out of the footer, the page it self still contains any needed information, e.g.:
{code}<meta name="application-name" content="JIRA" data-name="jira" data-version="6.4.1">{code}
Also all manuell changes are not fully prove for upcoming update and increase therefore the impact of maintenance. In short: Editing templates is just _quick and dirty_ and could not be the best practice.

I suggest to give end users (in administration role) the opportunity hide all internal information for not logged in users. Such a system should only provide the login mask and in addition to the EUA 6.4 the "powered by Atlassian" term.

*Benefit and Business value*
Each product become more secure and more resistant to potential attacks. In my opinion this is helpful for all of your business customer who needs there Atlassian stack or single product online.
fields.summary: JIRA provides many information to anonymous users
Add Transition Issue Permission to all users who have Close Issues Permission, during or after an upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43724].
  {panel}

Recently, we have had a few users(mainly those updating from JIRA 5.X to 6.X) complaining that they cannot close issues.

We requested that they run permission helper to ensure they had all necessary permissions which always showed they did.

When we requested that they send us their permission scheme, we realized they did not have permission to transition issues and deducing that since when you close an issue the issue has to change state from the current state it was in to closed state, we tested this and confirmed that they needed this permission.

We would appreciate if relationships between permissions are emphasized in the documentation so customers are aware of them.
fields.summary: Update Documentation Emphasizing the Need to have Transition Permission to Close Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43723].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
In certain situations, the first attempt to shut down Tomcat using:
* shutdown.sh _or_
* stop-jira.sh _or_
* catalina.sh stop

fails. A second attempt usually succeeds afterwards though.

h4. +Suggestion+
There's a KB that suggests several scripts to force a Tomcat shutdown if first attempt fails:
* [JIRA Does Not Terminate after Shutdown Script|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/the-jira-application-doesn-t-terminate-after-shutdown-script-is-executed-222200632.html]

It would be convenient if one of these scripts is integrated into the built-in shutdown scripts to reduce human efforts when such a case happens.
fields.summary: Improve built-in shutdown scripts to force a Tomcat shutdown if first attempt fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43721].
  {panel}

We've upgraded from 6.2.6 > 6.4.5 today, and the graph/chart that shows up on the main page of each project (Issues: 30 Day Summary) is no longer populated with any data, thus showing a flat graph.

I tested out functionality by creating a new issue, and the chart has indeed start plotting, but all previous 30 day statistics are lost.

FYI, we have completely re-indexed JIRA after the upgrade as well to try to resolve this issue.

Thank you
fields.summary: Issues: 30 Day Summary chart/graph broken after upgrading to 6.4.5
Automatically assign component based on Email Subject
JIRA Admins should be able to disable individual keyboard shortcut keys

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43718].
  {panel}

AS a JIRA Admin it is important for me to be able to see the adding or removal of subtasks in the history of a task.

Scenario:
# Create a task
# Add a subtask
# Remove subtask
# Click All tab

Observed Outcome:
No entries are made for the adding or removal of the subtask.

Desired Outcome:
Log entries should be made when a subtask is added or removed
fields.summary: Show Subtask Add\Remove in History

	at com.atlassian.scheduler.quartz1.Quartz1Job.execute(Quartz1Job.java:32)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:223)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
2015-06-04 02:57:50,398 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-3 INFO ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] synchronisation for directory [ 10001 ] starting

I read this issue:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43286

But I cannot locate the one it refers to:
JSP-230177

When we log on and view the users, we do see many inactive users.

Our user directory is configured with LDAP first and then Jira.

A workaround we have applied for now is manually adding them.
fields.summary: LDAP Connector - 2 users unable to log on, works for others

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43716].
  {panel}

I own several instances of Jira. One for production and the rest are for staging and QAs.

Sometimes we ended with people trigger reindex in production by mistake. I suggest we ask a question before re-index is triggered.

My first suggestion is:

Type the url of the jira instance.

So if I expected myself to run re-index in QA, but if I were on prod, I will fail.

Please consider this. Thank you
fields.summary: Ask question before re-index is triggered

fields.description:
When I'm writing a comment, if I press and +hold+ Ctrl+Enter the comment will be inserted multiple times. 

This was tested on Chrome and IE.
fields.summary: Inserting multiple comments
Description editor does not escape backslash

fields.description:
I used JIRA REST API to make significant bulk issue updates (api/2/search with GET, api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey} for PUT) with about 1000 REST requests in a row. After completion jvm consumes 100% of PS Old Gen.

The jmap histo command provides the following info:

{noformat}
num       #instances    #bytes  Class description
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
1:              1952054 138148088       char[]
2:              1762332 42295968        java.lang.String

fields.summary: Memory leaks in REST search and issue interfaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating an issue from mail with image, JIRA does not include image in issue.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create an issue from email with attachment (type jpeg). We used the attached image in our testing.

h3. Expected Results
Issue is created with attachment.

h3. Actual Results
# Issue is created without any attachment.
# No error in the logs.
 

h3.Workaround
Create an issue through email and add the attachment from UI.
fields.summary: Create issue from mail with image does not include image in issue

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce : 
# Create an issue from email with attachment (type jpeg)
# On the issue that is created, there is no attachment present


If same issue with the same attachment is created from the UI then the attachment is added without any problem.

For example, we tried with the attached image.
fields.summary: Create issue from mail with image does not include image in issue
Select Integrated applications.

fields.description: When copying an issue from JDOG to JAC, and there is a field that can't be copied, the offending field is HTML escaped.
fields.summary: Remote copy plugin escapes HTML for unmappable fields

fields.description: After discussion with [~rchaldecott]: the navigation steps should be clickable to allow for going back to previous steps (like in Bulk Edit). Also, the "Previous" Button should be added to allow for the same action using buttons.
fields.summary: Going back in Remote Issue Copy wizard

fields.description:
The javadoc says that the estimate is returned in milliseconds, but it is returned in SECONDS.

This may also apply for all other methods involving estimates.

As misstated facts like this can be very misleading for the developer, and cost a lot of time, please fix the Javadoc ASAP!
fields.summary: Issue.getOriginalEstimate() javadoc is GROSSLY misleading / wrong
Remote Issue Copy skips comment without any warning when its author cannot be mapped
Please create a feature request for injecting a script on the create screen to populate a custom field on selection of a project.
